Sampling from distributions

There is almost no difference between knowing a distribution’s density (and thus knowing its mean, variance, mode, or anything else about it) and being able to sample from the distribution.  On the one hand, if we can sample from a distribution, we can estimate the density with a histogram or kernel density estimator.  Conversely, I’ll discuss w... Propagation of error

Propagation of error describes how uncertainty in estimates propagates forward when we consider functions of those estimates. Suppose I have height and weight measurements for a sample of people.  What is the mean and variance of the BMI?  (BMI is 703 times the weight (in pounds) over the square of the height (in inches).)
